table.name: commodity
table.remarks: Linking material to material source

column.name: commodity_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing.

column.name: material_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to material.

column.name: material_source_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to material_source.

table.name: construction
table.remarks: Phases of construction for a heritage site

column.name: construction_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: heritage_site_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to heritage site.

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Start date of construction phase, with the degree of detail known (i.e. could be to the century, year, month, day).

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: End date of construction phase with the degree of detail known (i.e. could be to century, to month, day etc.)

column.name: start_date_artificial
column.remarks: Start date to be used for sorting construction phases - over-precise date. When only a year is known, January 1st is used.

column.name: end_date_artificial
column.remarks: End date to be used for sorting construction phases - over-precise date. When only a year is known, December 31st is used.

column.name: construction_desc
column.remarks: Short description of the construction phase. Appears on the website for non-primary phases of construction.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Other notes relating to the construction phase - not public.

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether or not the construction phase is public. Used to control appearance on the website.

column.name: is_primary
column.remarks: Whether or not this is the primary phase of construction. Will control where the information appears on the website. The initial phase of construction is not always the primary phase.

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Person who originally entered the record

column.name: entered_date
column.remarks: Date of original entry (autofilled with current time)

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Person who made the latest modification

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of the latest modification (auto updates on modification)

column.name: relative_position
column.remarks: Uses the dates to determine relative position for each heritage site.

table.name: construction_styles
table.remarks: Linking a phase of construction to one or more architectural styles

column.name: construction_style_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: construction_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to construction

column.name: style_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_style

column.name: is_primary_style
column.remarks: Whether the style is the primary style or a substyle

table.name: dic_century
table.remarks: Dictionary of centuries, and archaeological periods

column.name: century_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing.

column.name: century
column.remarks: Century e.g. 19th.

table.name: dic_county
table.remarks: Dictionary of counties

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: county
column.remarks: Full name of county

column.name: province
column.remarks: Full name of province

column.name: county_code
column.remarks: County code

table.name: dic_finish
table.remarks: Dictionary of material finishes (e.g. polished)

column.name: finish_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: finish
column.remarks: Material finish e.g. gauged

column.name: finish_description
column.remarks: Definition/source of the definition.

column.name: form_of_address
column.remarks: Abbreviated form of address e.g. Rev. Dr. Col

column.name: form_of_address_full
column.remarks: Full form of address e.g. Reverend Doctor Colonel

column.name: fossil_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing.

column.name: fossil_name
column.remarks: Fossils e.g. crinoids, brachiopods

table.name: dic_georef_protocol
table.remarks: Dictionary of georeferencing protocols

column.name: georef_protocol_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing

column.name: georef_protocol
column.remarks: Shorthand for the method

column.name: georef_protocol_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the method

column.name: georef_protocol_citation
column.remarks: Citation for the method

table.name: dic_grain_crystal_size
table.remarks: Dictionary of grain/crystal sizes

column.name: grain_crystal_size_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: grain_crystal_size
column.remarks: Size category of grain or crystals (e.g. fine).

table.name: dic_gsi_strat
table.remarks: Dictionary of lithostratigraphic unit names from Geological Survey Ireland

table.name: dic_heritage_site_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of heritage site types e.g. church, bank

column.name: heritage_site_type_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing.

column.name: heritage_site_type
column.remarks: Type of heritage site (e.g. church, house).

table.name: dic_ics_age
table.remarks: Dictionary of International Commission on Stratigraphy geological age names

column.name: ics_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing.

column.name: ics_name
column.remarks: International Commission on Stratigraphy timescale name.

column.name: earliest_age
column.remarks: Earliest age (Ma)

column.name: latest_age
column.remarks: Latest age (Ma)

column.name: ics_parent_id
column.remarks: ID of the parent ics_name.

column.name: ics_level
column.remarks: Level of age bin 1=Eon, 2=Era, 3=Period, 4=Epoch, 5=Age

table.name: dic_material_condition
table.remarks: Dictionary of material condition

column.name: material_condition
column.remarks: Condition from very good to very poor.

table.name: dic_material_position
table.remarks: Dictionary of material use position in a heritage site (interior, exterior)

column.name: material_position
column.remarks: Position in the building - interior or exterior

table.name: dic_material_source_distance
table.remarks: Dictionary of qualitative material source distance from heritage site (e.g. onsite, local)

column.name: material_source_distance
column.remarks: Relative distance of the material source from the heritage site - from onsite to international

table.name: dic_material_source_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of material source type (e.g. quarry, brickfield)

column.name: material_source_type
column.remarks: Source type - Quarry or Brickfield.

table.name: dic_material_type
table.remarks: Dictionary of materials, rock types from Macrostrat

column.name: material_type_id
column.remarks: Primary key, autoincrementing

column.name: material_name
column.remarks: Name of the material (e.g. granite, limestone, yellow brick, galena)

column.name: material_type
column.remarks: Material type (e.g. volcanic, carbonate, siliciclastic)

column.name: material_group
column.remarks: Material group (e.g. sandstones, mafic, felsic, Dunham, Folk)

column.name: material_class
column.remarks: Material class (igneous, sedimentary, metamorphic)

column.name: material_category
column.remarks: Primary material category (rock, mineral, other)

table.name: dic_person_suffix
table.remarks: Dictionary of suffixes for peoples names (e.g. Jr. Sr. Esq.)

column.name: suffix
column.remarks: Abbreviated suffix e.g. Jr. Esq.

column.name: suffix_full
column.remarks: Full version of suffix e.g. Junior, Esquire

table.name: dic_relationship
table.remarks: Dictionary of relationship between people (e.g. parent of)

column.name: relationship_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing integer

column.name: relationship
column.remarks: Description of the relationship e.g. owner of

table.name: dic_role
table.remarks: Dictionary of roles for people (e.g. architect, builder)

column.name: role
column.remarks: Role e.g. architect, builder, engineer

table.name: dic_status
table.remarks: Dictionary of status for material sources (e.g. active, inactive)

column.name: status
column.remarks: Status of a quarry e.g. active, inactive

column.name: status_definition
column.remarks: Definition of terms

table.name: dic_style
table.remarks: Dictionary of styles (e.g. Gothic, Romanesque)

column.name: style_name
column.remarks: Name of the style e.g. Gothic

column.name: style_description
column.remarks: Description of the style (with source if relevant)

column.name: alternate_names
column.remarks: Alternate name e.g. Neo-Gothic for Gothic Revival

table.name: dic_title
table.remarks: Dictionary of titles for people (e.g. Earl)

column.name: title_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing integer

column.name: title
column.remarks: Title, usually noble titles

table.name: dic_townland
table.remarks: Dictionary of townlands, downloaded from townlands.ie

table.name: dic_use_feature
table.remarks: Dictionary of features (e.g. column, wall)

column.name: use_feature
column.remarks: Feature e.g. wall, column

column.name: use_feature_description
column.remarks: Definition/decsription of the feature with source if relevant

column.name: alternate_names
column.remarks: Any alternate names for the feature

table.name: heritage_site
table.remarks: Heritages sites including their location and a description

column.name: heritage_site_id
column.remarks: Primary key, autoincrementing ID

column.name: heritage_site_name
column.remarks: Name of the heritage site. Not NULL, unique. If multiple sites exist with the same name, include additional identifying information as appropriate (e.g. town, city, county). Church of Ireland = CoI. Roman catholic = RC.

column.name: heritage_site_type_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dictionary of site types

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether the site is public or not. Used to control appearance on website.

column.name: address_locality
column.remarks: Street address if available, general name/locality if street address is not available

column.name: town_city
column.remarks: Town/City/Village name

column.name: lat_dec
column.remarks: Latitude as a decimal type (usually from google maps)

column.name: long_dec
column.remarks: Longitude as a decimal type (usually from google maps)

column.name: datum
column.remarks: Geodetic datum (usually WGS84 from google maps)

column.name: uncertainty_m
column.remarks: DarwinCore: The horizontal distance in meters from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude that describes the smallest enclosing circle that contains the whole of the location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term. This term corresponds with the geographic radial of the final georeference.

column.name: georef_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments out of the ordinary about the georeference, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol. e.g. assumed distance by road (Hwy. 101)

column.name: location_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments of interest about the location (not the georeference of the location, which go in georeferenceRemarks). e.g. Villa Epecuen was inundated in November 1985 and ceased to be inhabited until 2009

column.name: georef_date
column.remarks: Date georeferenced

column.name: georef_by
column.remarks: DarwinCore: the individual(s) who last modified the georeference and when that happened. These correspond to the final authority on the georeference in its current state, regardless of who might have worked on previous versions of the georeference.

column.name: georef_sources
column.remarks: DarwinCore: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

column.name: georef_protocol_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_georef_protocol

column.name: osi_six_last
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, last edition (1910s-1950s)

column.name: osi_six_first
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, first edition (1829-41)

column.name: osi_twentyfive
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 25-inch historical map (1897-1913)

column.name: townland_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim townland name. For use especially for areas without formal townland designation (e.g. in Dublin)

column.name: townland_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to townlands.ie dictionary

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dictionary of counties

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: Country code, ISO standard. Default: IE

column.name: heritage_site_desc
column.remarks: Details of the heritage site, which will appear on the website. HTML tags are included for formatting.

column.name: harbison_id
column.remarks: Identifier from Harbison, P. (1970). Guide to the National Monuments in the Republic of Ireland. 1st Ed. Gill and Macmillan, M.H. Gill & Co. U. C.

column.name: nat_mon_id
column.remarks: National Monument Number. Description from National Monuments Service: When a monument is taken into State ownership or guardianship its details are added to a National Monuments Register. In the earlier years, when a number of monuments were taken in State care at the same time, they were all given the same register number e.g. the monuments on the Dingle peninsula are all registered under number 221. Similarly, groups of monument such as the passage tombs at Lough Crew will have the same registration number. The register is not entirely up-to-date with the result that some of the more recent acquisitions have yet to be assigned numbers."

column.name: opw_monuments_ID
column.remarks: ID from spreadsheet from OPW of monuments in state care.

column.name: rmp_id
column.remarks: Description from National Monuments Service: Each monument is entered in the Record of Monuments and Places (RMP) as established under Section 12 of the National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1994. A unique identifying number is assigned to each monument and place in the record. The RMP number provides the link to the records of the Archaeological Survey of Ireland (ASI) which contains further information on the monument in question.

column.name: dia_id
column.remarks: ID from the Dictionary of Irish Architects.

column.name: niah_reg_no
column.remarks: Registration number from the National Inventory of Architectural Heritage (NIAH)

column.name: is_opw_site
column.remarks: Whether or not the heritage site is run by the Office of Public Works (OPW)

column.name: opw_url
column.remarks: Url for the Office of Public Works website (OPW)

column.name: century_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dictionary of centuries

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Person who originally entered the record

column.name: entered_date
column.remarks: Date of original entry

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Person who made the latest modification

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of latest modification - auto updates on modification

column.name: irish_grid_easting
column.remarks: Irish grid easting

column.name: irish_grid_northing
column.remarks: Irish grid northing

column.name: itm_easting
column.remarks: ITM easting

column.name: itm_northing
column.remarks: ITM northing

column.name: site_visit
column.remarks: Whether or not the site was visited in person

column.name: site_visit_by
column.remarks: Who visited the site

column.name: site_visit_date
column.remarks: Date of the last site visit

column.name: site_visit_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the visit

column.name: notes
column.remarks: General additional notes, not for public website

column.name: geom
column.remarks: Point data type generated from decimal lat and long

column.name: heritage_site_tag
column.remarks: Autogenerated unique tag for heritage sites, used to link heritage sites to references in Zotero and images in the WP image library. Created by taking the heritage site name and removing all special characters/punctuation, replacing spaces and slashes with underscores.

table.name: location
table.remarks: Locations/Addresses for stoneworks, marble mills etc.

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: PK autoincrement id

column.name: address_locality
column.remarks: Street address where possible, general name/locality if street address is not available

column.name: town_city
column.remarks: Town/City/Village name

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether the location is public or not (will appear on website)

column.name: start_year
column.remarks: Year the site opened

column.name: end_year
column.remarks: Year the site was closed

column.name: active_dates_verbatim
column.remarks: Active dates, in whatever format is available.

column.name: townland_id
column.remarks: FK Links to dictionary from townlands.ie

column.name: townland_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim townland - may include parishes etc where townland is not available

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: FK references dic_county

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: Country code - default is IE

column.name: itm_easting
column.remarks: Irish ITM easting

column.name: itm_northing
column.remarks: Irish ITM northing

column.name: site_visit
column.remarks: Whether or not the site was visited in person

column.name: site_visit_by
column.remarks: Who visited the site

column.name: site_visit_date
column.remarks: Date of the last site visit

column.name: site_visit_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the visit

column.name: irish_grid_easting
column.remarks: Irish grid easting

column.name: irish_grid_northing
column.remarks: Irish grid northing

column.name: lat_dec
column.remarks: Decimal latitude

column.name: long_dec
column.remarks: Decimal longitude

column.name: datum
column.remarks: Datum for decimal lat-long eg. WGS84

column.name: uncertainty_m
column.remarks: DarwinCore: The horizontal distance in meters from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude that describes the smallest enclosing circle that contains the whole of the location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term. This term corresponds with the geographic radial of the final georeference.

column.name: georef_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments out of the ordinary about the georeference, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol. e.g. assumed distance by road (Hwy. 101)

column.name: location_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments of interest about the location (not the georeference of the location, which go in georeferenceRemarks). e.g. Villa Epecuen was inundated in November 1985 and ceased to be inhabited until 2009

column.name: georef_by
column.remarks: DarwinCore: the individual(s) who last modified the georeference and when that happened. These correspond to the final authority on the georeference in its current state, regardless of who might have worked on previous versions of the georeference.

column.name: georef_date
column.remarks: Date georeferenced

column.name: georef_sources
column.remarks: DarwinCore: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

column.name: georef_protocol_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_georef_protocol

column.name: osi_six_last
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, last edition (1910s-1950s)

column.name: osi_six_first
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, first edition (1829-41)

column.name: osi_twentyfive
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 25-inch historical map (1897-1913)

column.name: notes_public
column.remarks: Notes that would/could appear on the website.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Additional notes - these will not be published on the website

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Person who entered the initial record

column.name: entered_date
column.remarks: Date of original entry. Autogenerated with current timestamp

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Person who made the latest modification

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of latest modification. Autogenerated current timestamp on update

column.name: geom
column.remarks: Stored computed column. Creates geom point from lat_dec and long_dec

column.name: location_tag
column.remarks: Autogenerated tag

table.name: material
table.remarks: Materials (stones) including a description and their geological context.

column.name: material_id
column.remarks: PK autoincrementing unique identifier for materials

column.name: parent_material_id
column.remarks: FK self referencing to record when a material is a subset of another e.g. Wickow Granite is a subset of Leinster Granite

column.name: common_name
column.remarks: The common name for the material e.g. Connemara marble

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether or not the material is public (will appear on website)

column.name: alternative_names
column.remarks: Alternative name(s) for materials.

column.name: material_type_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_material_type

column.name: material_name_verbatim
column.remarks: Specific rock type or mineral name

column.name: colour
column.remarks: Colour or colour range of the stone

column.name: colour_variation
column.remarks: Variation of colour

column.name: grain_crystal_size_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_grain_crystal_size

column.name: context_of_use
column.remarks: Where the material is usually used.

column.name: material_desc
column.remarks: General description, discussion of the material. Public formatted version which appears on the website.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Notes, not public for internal use only

column.name: age_ics_id
column.remarks: FK. Id of the international commission on stratigraphy age name

column.name: age_verbatim
column.remarks: Geological age verbatim e.g. local age name

column.name: geol_group
column.remarks: Geological group name

column.name: geol_formation
column.remarks: Geological formation name

column.name: geol_member
column.remarks: Geological member name

column.name: geol_strat_verbatim
column.remarks: Lithostratigraphy, originally as reported on google sheets

column.name: lithostrat_id
column.remarks: Link to dictionary of lithostratigraphy from GSI

column.name: bgs_strat_code
column.remarks: Code from the British Geological Survey Lexicon of named stratigraphic units https://www.bgs.ac.uk/technologies/the-bgs-lexicon-of-named-rock-units/

column.name: strat_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the stratigraphy

column.name: country_of_origin
column.remarks: Country material originates from

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: Link to dic_county for county of origin

column.name: is_in_eurlithos
column.remarks: Presence or absence in Eurlithos database (EN 12440)

column.name: nsdni_url
column.remarks: URL for Northern Irish Natural Stone Database (stonedatabase.com)

column.name: bsds_id
column.remarks: ID for Scottish Building Stone Database. Find the ID for stones in the URL. Quarry ID is visible in tables.

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Data orginally entered by

column.name: entered_date
column.remarks: Date of original entry

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Person who made the latest modification

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of latest modification

column.name: material_tag
column.remarks: Autogenerated Tag for materials, used to link to references and photos. Created by taking the common name and removing all special characters/punctuation, replacing spaces with underscores.

table.name: material_fossil
table.remarks: Linking materials to one or more fossils

column.name: material_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. Link to material

column.name: fossil_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. Link to dic_fossil

table.name: material_sample
table.remarks: Linking materials to one or more museum samples

column.name: material_id
column.remarks: PK/FK. Link to material

column.name: arctos_code
column.remarks: Code from Arctos

column.name: sample_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the sample - only if details not captured in Arctos.

table.name: material_source
table.remarks: Material Sources (quarries) including a description and their location.

column.name: material_source_id
column.remarks: PK autoincrement id

column.name: parent_material_source_id
column.remarks: Parent id - references material_id

column.name: material_source_name
column.remarks: Name of the quarry or brickfield

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether the material source is public or not (will appear on website)

column.name: material_source_type_id
column.remarks: FK references dic_material_source_type - the type of site (quarry/brickfield)

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Date the site opened

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: Date the site was closed

column.name: start_date_artificial
column.remarks: Start date to be used for sorting - over precise date. When only a year is known, January 1st is used.

column.name: end_date_artificial
column.remarks: End date to be used for sorting - over-precise date. When only a year is known, December 31st is used.

column.name: status_id
column.remarks: FK references dic_status - whether the site is active, inactive or closed

column.name: material_source_desc
column.remarks: Description - version published on the website.

column.name: address_locality
column.remarks: Street address if available, general name/locality if street address is not available e.g. 2km S of Athlone

column.name: town_city
column.remarks: Town/City/Village name

column.name: townland_id
column.remarks: FK Links to dictionary from townlands.ie

column.name: townland_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim townland - may include parishes etc where townland is not available

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: FK references dic_county

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: Country code - default is IE

column.name: itm_easting
column.remarks: Irish ITM easting

column.name: itm_northing
column.remarks: Irish ITM northing

column.name: site_visit
column.remarks: Whether or not the site was visited in person

column.name: site_visit_by
column.remarks: Who visited the site

column.name: site_visit_date
column.remarks: Date of the last site visit

column.name: site_visit_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the visit

column.name: irish_grid_easting
column.remarks: Irish grid easting

column.name: irish_grid_northing
column.remarks: Irish grid northing

column.name: lat_dec
column.remarks: Decimal latitude

column.name: long_dec
column.remarks: Decimal longitude

column.name: datum
column.remarks: Datum for decimal lat-long eg. WGS84

column.name: uncertainty_m
column.remarks: DarwinCore: The horizontal distance in meters from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude that describes the smallest enclosing circle that contains the whole of the location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term. This term corresponds with the geographic radial of the final georeference.

column.name: georef_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments out of the ordinary about the georeference, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol. e.g. assumed distance by road (Hwy. 101)

column.name: location_remarks
column.remarks: DarwinCore: Notes or comments of interest about the location (not the georeference of the location, which go in georeferenceRemarks). e.g. Villa Epecuen was inundated in November 1985 and ceased to be inhabited until 2009

column.name: georef_by
column.remarks: DarwinCore: the individual(s) who last modified the georeference and when that happened. These correspond to the final authority on the georeference in its current state, regardless of who might have worked on previous versions of the georeference.

column.name: georef_date
column.remarks: Date georeferenced

column.name: georef_protocol_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_georef_protocol

column.name: osi_six_last
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, last edition (1910s-1950s)

column.name: osi_six_first
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 6-inch historical map, first edition (1829-41)

column.name: osi_twentyfive
column.remarks: Presence or absence on OSI 25-inch historical map (1897-1913)

column.name: material_type_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_material_type. Primary material type for this source.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Additional notes - these will not be published on the website

column.name: nsd_url
column.remarks: Link to the URL of the Northern Ireland Natural Stone Database

column.name: active_quarry_id
column.remarks: GSI active quarry and pit ID.

column.name: county_geo_code
column.remarks: GSI county geological site code

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Person who entered the initial record

column.name: entered_date
column.remarks: Date of original entry. Autogenerated with current timestamp

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Person who made the latest modification

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of latest modification. Autogenerated current timestamp on update

column.name: geom
column.remarks: Stored computed column. Creates geom point from lat_dec and long_dec

column.name: material_source_tag
column.remarks: Autopopulated. Tag used for references and images. Created from material source name, punctuation and special characters removed and spaces and slashes replaced by underscores

table.name: material_use
table.remarks: Material use in a heritage site. Central linking table, including details of where and how the material was used.

column.name: material_use_id
column.remarks: Primary key for material_use, auto-incrementing

column.name: heritage_site_id
column.remarks: FK. Heritage_site_id links to heritage_site

column.name: construction_id
column.remarks: FK. Links to a particular phase of construction.

column.name: commodity_id
column.remarks: FK commodity_id links to commodity (material and material_source)

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to location

column.name: use_feature_id
column.remarks: FK. Links to dictionary of feature types.

column.name: is_original
column.remarks: Whether the material is original or not

column.name: material_condition_id
column.remarks: FK. Links to dictionary of material condition

column.name: material_use_detail
column.remarks: Described where the material is used

column.name: material_position_id
column.remarks: FK interior or exterior

column.name: source_distance_id
column.remarks: FK. How far away the material came from.

column.name: documentary_sources
column.remarks: Source of the information (format for front end)

table.name: material_use_finish
table.remarks: Linking material use to one or more finishes

column.name: material_use_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to material use.

column.name: finish_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_finish.

table.name: person
table.remarks: People and firms/companies, including dates

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: PK autoincrementing unique identifer for people

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: Last name of the person

column.name: first_names
column.remarks: First names of the person

column.name: form_of_address_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_form_of_address

column.name: person_suffix_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_person_suffix

column.name: birth_year
column.remarks: Birth year (YYYY)

column.name: death_year
column.remarks: Death year (YYYY)

column.name: birth_date
column.remarks: Birth date

column.name: death_date
column.remarks: Death date

column.name: birth_date_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim birth date

column.name: death_date_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim death date

column.name: floruit_start
column.remarks: A start year for when this person or organization was most active (especially if no birth-death dates known).

column.name: floruit_end
column.remarks: End year for when this person or organization was active (esp. if birth-death dates not known).

column.name: dia_id
column.remarks: Dictionary of Irish Architects ID

column.name: dib_doi
column.remarks: DOI for the Dictionary of Irish Biography

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any notes about the person

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Primary role id - links to dictionary of roles

column.name: primary_location
column.remarks: Primary location of the person, can be useful for distinguishing between people with the same name. Concatented with name e.g. John Smith (of Mayo).

column.name: wikidata_id
column.remarks: Wikidata ID

column.name: person_tag_old
column.remarks: Stores the old person tag, now replaced with an auto-generated version.

column.name: is_individual
column.remarks: Whether or not this is a single person or other (company, group etc.)

column.name: is_public
column.remarks: Whether or not the information is public - will control appearance on the website.

column.name: is_current
column.remarks: Whether or not the person/firm is current

column.name: trading_as
column.remarks: Trading as, abbreviated to t/a.

column.name: person_desc
column.remarks: Description of the person

column.name: modified_date
column.remarks: Date of latest modification

column.name: pre_tag
column.remarks: Concatentates last name, first names, birth year, death year and primary location. First step to auto-generate a tag for the person.

column.name: person_tag
column.remarks: Autogenerates a tag for people by removing special characters (except ampersands) from the pre-tag and replacing spaces with underscores.

table.name: person_construction
table.remarks: Linking people to phases of construction

column.name: person_construction_id
column.remarks: PK. Auto incrementing

column.name: construction_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to construction.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to person.

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_role.

column.name: is_primary
column.remarks: Whether this person is one of the primary examples of this role. Controls order of appearance on website for architects specifically (primary architects vs. other architects). Default is FALSE.

column.name: person_construction_desc
column.remarks: Notes about the link between person and construction which can be made public (but currently not exposed on the website). This column contains some notes from the original STONEBUILT spreadsheet.

column.name: documentary_sources
column.remarks: References that link this person to this construction phase

column.name: name_verbatim
column.remarks: Name of the person as originally reported - could be a variation of the version in the person table.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Other relevant notes for internal use only.

table.name: person_location
table.remarks: Linking people to a location (e.g. a marble mill, stoneworks)

column.name: person_location_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing ID.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to person table.

column.name: location_id
column.remarks: FK. Location table.

column.name: start_year
column.remarks: Year the person was first associated with the location.

column.name: end_year
column.remarks: Year the person was last associated with the location

column.name: start_year_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim start year, can be used to express uncertainty e.g. c.1981

column.name: end_year_verbatim
column.remarks: Verbatim end year, can be used to express uncertainty e.g. c.1981

column.name: start_date_artificial
column.remarks: Start date to be used for sorting - overprecise. January 1st used where only year is known.

column.name: end_date_artificial
column.remarks: End date to be used for sorting - overprecise. December 31st used where only year is known.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Notes about the person's link to the location

column.name: documentary_sources
column.remarks: Sources which refer specifically to the persons link to the location.

table.name: person_material_source
table.remarks: Linking people to a material source (e.g. owner of a quarry)

column.name: person_material_source_id
column.remarks: Primary key, autoincrementing

column.name: material_source_id
column.remarks: Link to material_source table

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Link to person table

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: Link to dic_role table

column.name: dates
column.remarks: Dates when this person or organization was related to the material source. Usually not precise. Where known ranges should have the following format: 1800-1810.

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Start date, with the degree of detail known (i.e. could be to the century, year, month, day).

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: End date, with the degree of detail known (i.e. could be to the century, year, month, day).

column.name: start_date_artificial
column.remarks: Date when this person was first associated with the material source. Over-precise date, for sorting purposes.

column.name: end_date_artificial
column.remarks: Date when the person stopped being associated with the material source. Over-precise, to be used for sorting.

column.name: is_primary
column.remarks: Is the primary person associated with this material source

column.name: notes_public
column.remarks: Notes about the relationship of this person (or group) to the material source

column.name: verbatim_name
column.remarks: Verbatim name of the person/group

column.name: notes_other
column.remarks: Any other notes, not for the website

column.name: documentary_sources
column.remarks: Sources linking person to material_source

table.name: person_material_use
table.remarks: Linking people to a material use (e.g. stonemason to a carving)

column.name: material_use_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to material use

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. The person working on this feature

column.name: role_id
column.remarks: FK. The role the person had while working on this feature (e.g. as a stoneworker)

column.name: person_location_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to person_location

column.name: is_primary
column.remarks: Whether or not this person was the primary person working on this feature

column.name: notes_public
column.remarks: Notes which could be made public about the person's link to the material use.

column.name: notes_other
column.remarks: Internal notes

table.name: person_relationship
table.remarks: Linking people to other people e.g. parents/children

column.name: person_relationship_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing integer.

column.name: person_id1
column.remarks: FK. First person.

column.name: person_id2
column.remarks: FK. Second person.

column.name: relationship_id
column.remarks: FK. Relationship type, link to dic_relationship

column.name: relationship_notes
column.remarks: Notes about the relationship.

column.name: documentary_sources
column.remarks: Documentary sources about the relationship

column.name: entered_by
column.remarks: Person who entered the initial record

table.name: person_title
table.remarks: Linking people to one or more titles

column.name: person_title_id
column.remarks: PK. Autoincrementing

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to person table

column.name: title_id
column.remarks: FK. Link to dic_title.

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: Year when the person was first associated with the title

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: Year when the person was last associated with the title

column.name: title_number
column.remarks: If the title has a number, e.g. 1st Earl of Mayo, enter position here (as an integer).

column.name: title_location
column.remarks: If the title is tied to a place e.g. Earl of Mayo, then enter the place name here.
